meanings.definition: A smaller group within a larger group, typically sharing similar characteristics or traits.
meanings.sent1: In the science class, the teacher asked us to work in a subgrouping to study different animals.
meanings.sent2: The subgrouping of students who enjoy playing soccer meets every Friday after school.
meanings.sent3: The subgrouping of friends who all love pizza decided to have a pizza-eating contest.
meanings.sent4: The subgrouping of flowers in the garden bloomed in a beautiful array of colors.
meanings.sent5: The subgrouping of birds chirped together in perfect harmony.

meanings.definition: The act of dividing a larger group into smaller, more specific groups.
meanings.sent1: During the project, the subgrouping of tasks made it easier for everyone to contribute.
meanings.sent2: The subgrouping of books in the library by genre helps patrons find what they are looking for.
meanings.sent3: The subgrouping of ingredients in the recipe made it seem like a complicated science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The subgrouping of stars in the night sky created a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent5: The subgrouping of colors in the painting added depth and interest to the artwork.
